comment:
* A callback for number verification. After a request for number verification is received,
 * the system will call {@link #onCallReceived(String)} if a phone call was received from a number
 * matching the provided {@link PhoneNumberRange} or it will call {@link #onVerificationFailed(int)}
 * if an error occurs.
 * @hide

variables.name: REASON_UNSPECIFIED
variables.comment: * Verification failed for an unspecified reason.

variables.name: REASON_TIMED_OUT
variables.comment:
* Verification failed because no phone call was received from a matching number within the
     * provided timeout.

variables.name: REASON_NETWORK_NOT_AVAILABLE
variables.comment: * Verification failed because no cellular voice network is available.

variables.name: REASON_TOO_MANY_CALLS
variables.comment:
* Verification failed because there are currently too many ongoing phone calls for a new
     * incoming phone call to be received.

variables.name: REASON_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS
variables.comment: * Verification failed because a previous request for verification has not yet completed.

variables.name: REASON_IN_ECBM
variables.comment: * Verification failed because the phone is in emergency callback mode.

variables.name: REASON_IN_EMERGENCY_CALL
variables.comment: * Verification failed because the phone is currently in an emergency call.

methods.name: void onCallReceived(@NonNull String phoneNumber)
methods.comment:
* Called when the device receives a phone call from the provided {@link PhoneNumberRange}.
     * @param phoneNumber The phone number within the range that called. May or may not contain the
     *                    country code, but will be entirely numeric.

methods.name: void onVerificationFailed(@NumberVerificationFailureReason int reason)
methods.comment:
* Called when verification fails for some reason.
     * @param reason The reason for failure.
